title: Wrong calculation of RX-Input normalization factor
body:
Ciao,

I was trying to manually calculating the 'RX-Input' normalization factors from the number of reads reported by SpikeFlow, and I was getting different values w.r.t the ones computed by SpikeFlow.
I was looking at the code used to compute the scaling factor and I noticed a possible error, at this lines: https://github.com/DavideBrex/SpikeFlow/blob/7dd55487d490f4a49e077b175021dbaff9eb2118/workflow/scripts/computeNormFactors.py#L54-L56 `gamma` is computed by dividing the number of `LowMapQReads` (`info_input[2]`) and `NSpikeReads` (`info_input[1]`). Indeed, if I use those reads number, I get the same normalization factors as the ones reported by SpikeFlow.

Cheers,
Alessandro
